info.title: PlayFab Admin API
info.description: APIs for managing title configurations, uploaded Game Server code executables, and user data

post.description: Creates a new player segment by defining the conditions on player properties. Also, create actions to target the player segments for a title.
post.x-requestDetails: Send all the segment details part of CreateSegmentRequest

post.description: Deletes an existing player segment and its associated action(s) for a title.
post.x-requestDetails: Send segment id planning to delete part of DeleteSegmentRequest object

post.description: Retrieves a download URL for the requested report
post.x-requestDetails: Gets the download URL for the requested report data (in CSV form). The reports available through this API call are those available in the Game Manager, in the Analytics->Reports tab.

post.description: Retrieves the configuration information for all player statistics defined in the title, regardless of whether they have a reset interval.
post.x-responseDetails: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. The ResetInterval defines the period of time at which the leaderboard for the statistic will automatically reset. Upon reset, the statistic updates to a new version with no values (effectively removing all players from the leaderboard). The previous version's statistic values are also archived for retrieval, if needed (see GetPlayerStatisticVersions). Statistics not created via a call to CreatePlayerStatisticDefinition by default have a VersionChangeInterval of Never, meaning they do not reset on a schedule, but they can be set to do so via a call to UpdatePlayerStatisticDefinition. Once a statistic has been reset (sometimes referred to as versioned or incremented), the previous version can still be written to for up a short, pre-defined period (currently 10 seconds), to prevent issues with levels completing around the time of the reset. Also, once reset, the historical statistics for players in the title may be retrieved using the URL specified in the version information (GetPlayerStatisticVersions). The AggregationMethod defines what action is taken when a new statistic value is submitted - always update with the new value (Last), use the highest of the old and new values (Max), use the smallest (Min), or add them together (Sum).

post.description: Retrieves the information on the available versions of the specified statistic.
post.x-responseDetails: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. The information returned in the results defines the state of a specific version of a statistic, including when it was or will become the currently active version, when it will (or did) become a previous version, and its archival state if it is no longer the active version. For a statistic which has been reset, once the archival status is Complete, the full set of statistics for all players in the leaderboard for that version may be retrieved via the ArchiveDownloadUrl. Statistics which have not been reset (incremented/versioned) will only have a single version which is not scheduled to reset.

post.description: Get detail information of a segment and its associated definition(s) and action(s) for a title.
post.x-requestDetails: Send segment filter details part of GetSegmentsRequest object

ApiErrorWrapper.description: The basic wrapper around every failed API response

errorDetails.description: Detailed description of individual issues with the request object

Active.description: The active state of this ban. Expired bans may still have this value set to true but they will have no effect.

BanId.description: The unique Ban Id associated with this ban.

Created.description: The time when this ban was applied.

Expires.description: The time when this ban expires. Permanent bans do not have expiration date.

IPAddress.description: The IP address on which the ban was applied. May affect multiple players.

PlayFabId.description: Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

Reason.description: The reason why this ban was applied.

DurationInHours.description: The duration in hours for the ban. Leave this blank for a permanent ban.

IPAddress.description: IP address to be banned. May affect multiple players.

PlayFabId.description: Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

Reason.description: The reason for this ban. Maximum 140 characters.

Name.description: The name of the email info data

VerificationStatus.description: The verification status of the email

Name.description: The name of the email info data

VerificationStatus.description: The verification status of the email

CreateSegmentRequest.description: Send all the segment details part of CreateSegmentRequest

SegmentModel.description: Segment model with all of the segment properties data.

DeletePlayerRequest.description: Deletes all data associated with the player, including statistics, custom data, inventory, purchases, virtual currency balances, characters and shared group memberships. Removes the player from all leaderboards and player search indexes. Does not delete PlayStream event history associated with the player. Does not delete the publisher user account that created the player in the title nor associated data such as username, password, email address, account linkages, or friends list. Note, this API queues the player for deletion and returns immediately. It may take several minutes or more before all player data is fully deleted. Until the player data is fully deleted, attempts to recreate the player with the same user account in the same title will fail with the 'AccountDeleted' error.

PlayFabId.description: Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

DeletePlayerSharedSecretRequest.description: Player Shared Secret Keys are used for the call to Client/GetTitlePublicKey, which exchanges the shared secret for an RSA CSP blob to be used to encrypt the payload of account creation requests when that API requires a signature header.

SecretKey.description: The shared secret key to delete

DeleteSegmentRequest.description: Send segment id planning to delete part of DeleteSegmentRequest object

FunctionParameterJson.description: Cloud script function parameter json text.

URL.description: URL for uploading content via HTTP PUT method. The URL requires the 'x-ms-blob-type' header to have the value 'BlockBlob'. The URL will expire in approximately one hour.

GetDataReportRequest.description: Gets the download URL for the requested report data (in CSV form). The reports available through this API call are those available in the Game Manager, in the Analytics->Reports tab.

DownloadUrl.description: The URL where the requested report can be downloaded. This can be any PlayFab generated reports. The full list of reports can be found at: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/gaming/playfab/features/analytics/reports/quickstart.

GetPlayerStatisticDefinitionsResult.description: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. The ResetInterval defines the period of time at which the leaderboard for the statistic will automatically reset. Upon reset, the statistic updates to a new version with no values (effectively removing all players from the leaderboard). The previous version's statistic values are also archived for retrieval, if needed (see GetPlayerStatisticVersions). Statistics not created via a call to CreatePlayerStatisticDefinition by default have a VersionChangeInterval of Never, meaning they do not reset on a schedule, but they can be set to do so via a call to UpdatePlayerStatisticDefinition. Once a statistic has been reset (sometimes referred to as versioned or incremented), the previous version can still be written to for up a short, pre-defined period (currently 10 seconds), to prevent issues with levels completing around the time of the reset. Also, once reset, the historical statistics for players in the title may be retrieved using the URL specified in the version information (GetPlayerStatisticVersions). The AggregationMethod defines what action is taken when a new statistic value is submitted - always update with the new value (Last), use the highest of the old and new values (Max), use the smallest (Min), or add them together (Sum).

Statistics.description: the player statistic definitions for the title

CustomTags.description: The optional custom tags associated with the request (e.g. build number, external trace identifiers, etc.).

GetPlayerStatisticVersionsResult.description: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. The information returned in the results defines the state of a specific version of a statistic, including when it was or will become the currently active version, when it will (or did) become a previous version, and its archival state if it is no longer the active version. For a statistic which has been reset, once the archival status is Complete, the full set of statistics for all players in the leaderboard for that version may be retrieved via the ArchiveDownloadUrl. Statistics which have not been reset (incremented/versioned) will only have a single version which is not scheduled to reset.

StatisticVersions.description: version change history of the statistic

ABTestParent.description: Identifier of the segments AB Test, if it is attached to one.

GetSegmentsRequest.description: Given input segment ids, return list of segments.

SegmentIds.description: Segment ids to filter title segments.

GrantedItemInstance.description: Result of granting an item to a user. Note, to retrieve additional information for an item such as Tags, Description that are the same across all instances of the item, a call to GetCatalogItems is required. The ItemID of can be matched to a catalog entry, which contains the additional information. Also note that Custom Data is only set when the User's specific instance has updated the CustomData via a call to UpdateUserInventoryItemCustomData. Other fields such as UnitPrice and UnitCurrency are only set when the item was granted via a purchase.

Annotation.description: Game specific comment associated with this instance when it was added to the user inventory.

BundleContents.description: Array of unique items that were awarded when this catalog item was purchased.

BundleParent.description: Unique identifier for the parent inventory item, as defined in the catalog, for object which were added from a bundle or container.

CatalogVersion.description: Catalog version for the inventory item, when this instance was created.

CharacterId.description: Unique PlayFab assigned ID for a specific character owned by a user

CustomData.description: A set of custom key-value pairs on the instance of the inventory item, which is not to be confused with the catalog item's custom data.

DisplayName.description: CatalogItem.DisplayName at the time this item was purchased.

Expiration.description: Timestamp for when this instance will expire.

ItemClass.description: Class name for the inventory item, as defined in the catalog.

ItemId.description: Unique identifier for the inventory item, as defined in the catalog.

ItemInstanceId.description: Unique item identifier for this specific instance of the item.

PlayFabId.description: Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

PurchaseDate.description: Timestamp for when this instance was purchased.

RemainingUses.description: Total number of remaining uses, if this is a consumable item.

UnitCurrency.description: Currency type for the cost of the catalog item. Not available when granting items.

UnitPrice.description: Cost of the catalog item in the given currency. Not available when granting items.

UsesIncrementedBy.description: The number of uses that were added or removed to this item in this call.

IncrementLimitedEditionItemAvailabilityR.description: This operation will increment the global counter for the number of these items available. This number cannot be decremented, except by actual grants.

CatalogVersion.description: Which catalog is being updated. If null, uses the default catalog.

CustomTags.description: The optional custom tags associated with the request (e.g. build number, external trace identifiers, etc.).

ItemId.description: The item which needs more availability.

IncrementPlayerStatisticVersionRequest.description: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. When this call is made on a given statistic, this forces a reset of that statistic. Upon reset, the statistic updates to a new version with no values (effectively removing all players from the leaderboard). The previous version's statistic values are also archived for retrieval, if needed (see GetPlayerStatisticVersions). Statistics not created via a call to CreatePlayerStatisticDefinition by default have a VersionChangeInterval of Never, meaning they do not reset on a schedule, but they can be set to do so via a call to UpdatePlayerStatisticDefinition. Once a statistic has been reset (sometimes referred to as versioned or incremented), the now-previous version can still be written to for up a short, pre-defined period (currently 10 seconds), to prevent issues with levels completing around the time of the reset. Also, once reset, the historical statistics for players in the title may be retrieved using the URL specified in the version information (GetPlayerStatisticVersions).

CustomTags.description: The optional custom tags associated with the request (e.g. build number, external trace identifiers, etc.).

StatisticVersion.description: version change history of the statistic

Level.description: Insights Performance Level to scale to.

Email.description: Linked account email of the user on the platform, if available

PlatformUserId.description: Unique account identifier of the user on the platform

Username.description: Linked account username of the user on the platform, if available

ContinentCode.description: The two-character continent code for this location

CountryCode.description: The two-character ISO 3166-1 country code for the country associated with the location

Latitude.description: Latitude coordinate of the geographic location.

Longitude.description: Longitude coordinate of the geographic location.

Data.description: Optional object accompanying the message as contextual information

NameIdentifier.description: Identifier by either name or ID. Note that a name may change due to renaming, or reused after being deleted. ID is immutable and unique.

City.description: City of the player's geographic location.

ContinentCode.description: The two-character continent code for this location

CountryCode.description: The two-character ISO 3166-1 country code for the country associated with the location

Latitude.description: Latitude coordinate of the player's geographic location.

Longitude.description: Longitude coordinate of the player's geographic location.

StatisticVersion.description: Statistic version (0 if not a versioned statistic)

AggregationMethod.description: the aggregation method to use in updating the statistic (defaults to last)

CurrentVersion.description: current active version of the statistic, incremented each time the statistic resets

VersionChangeInterval.description: interval at which the values of the statistic for all players are reset automatically

ActivationTime.description: time when the statistic version became active

ArchiveDownloadUrl.description: URL for the downloadable archive of player statistic values, if available

DeactivationTime.description: time when the statistic version became inactive due to statistic version incrementing

ScheduledActivationTime.description: time at which the statistic version was scheduled to become active, based on the configured ResetInterval

ScheduledDeactivationTime.description: time at which the statistic version was scheduled to become inactive, based on the configured ResetInterval

StatisticName.description: name of the statistic when the version became active

AdCampaignFilter.description: Filter property for ad campaign filter.

ChurnPredictionFilter.description: Filter property for player churn risk level.

FirstLoginDateFilter.description: Filter property for first login date.

FirstLoginFilter.description: Filter property for first login timespan.

LastLoginDateFilter.description: Filter property for last login date.

LastLoginFilter.description: Filter property for last login timespan.

LinkedUserAccountFilter.description: Filter property for linked in user account.

LinkedUserAccountHasEmailFilter.description: Filter property for linked in user account has email.

PlayerChurnPredictionFilter.description: Filter property for current player churn value.

PlayerChurnPredictionTimeFilter.description: Filter property for player churn timespan.

PlayerChurnPreviousPredictionFilter.description: Filter property for previous player churn value.

TotalValueToDateInUSDFilter.description: Filter property for total value to date in USD.

ValueToDateFilter.description: Filter property for value to date.

EnteredSegmentActions.description: Segment actions for current entered segment players.

LeftSegmentActions.description: Segment actions for current left segment players.

SegmentOrDefinitions.description: Segment or definitions. This includes segment and definitions and filters.

DeletePlayerStatisticAction.description: Delete player statistic segment trigger action.

ExecuteAzureFunctionAction.description: Execute azure function segment trigger action.

ExecuteCloudScriptAction.description: Execute cloud script segment trigger action.

GrantVirtualCurrencyAction.description: Grant virtual currency segment trigger action.

IncrementPlayerStatisticAction.description: Increment player statistic segment trigger action.

Version.description: Statistic version (0 if not a versioned statistic)

TagValue.description: Full value of the tag, including namespace

Amount.description: Total value to date USD amount.

Comparison.description: Total value to date USD comparison.

Currency.description: ISO 4217 code of the currency used in the purchases

TotalValue.description: Total value of the purchases in a whole number of 1/100 monetary units. For example, 999 indicates nine dollars and ninety-nine cents when Currency is 'USD')

TotalValueAsDecimal.description: Total value of the purchases in a string representation of decimal monetary units. For example, '9.99' indicates nine dollars and ninety-nine cents when Currency is 'USD'.

CurrencyCode.description: unique two-character identifier for this currency type (e.g.: "CC")

DisplayName.description: friendly name to show in the developer portal, reports, etc.

InitialDeposit.description: amount to automatically grant users upon first login to the title

RechargeMax.description: maximum amount to which the currency will recharge (cannot exceed MaxAmount, but can be less)

RechargeRate.description: rate at which the currency automatically be added to over time, in units per day (24 hours)

None.name: None
None.description: This API requires no authentication headers (usually provides one to other calls).

SessionTicket.name: X-Authorization
SessionTicket.description: This API requires a client session ticket, available from any Client Login function.

SecretKey.name: X-SecretKey
SecretKey.description: This API requires a title secret key, available to title admins, from PlayFab Game Manager.

EntityToken.name: X-EntityToken
EntityToken.description: This API requires an Entity Session Token, available from the Entity GetEntityToken method.
